Class Interval

  • java.lang.Object
    • Interval
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Interval>

    public class Interval
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Interval>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval(boolean universal, boolean empty)
      If universal is true min will be set to negative infinity and max will be set to positive infinity.
      Interval(double min, double max)
      Create a new Interval, if min is greater than or equal to max throws illegal argument exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interval

        public Interval(double min,
                double max)
        Create a new Interval, if min is greater than or equal to max throws illegal argument exception.
        Parameters:
        min - Double minimum value of the tuple
        max - Double maximum value of the tuple
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if min is greater or equal to max

      • Interval

        public Interval(boolean universal,
                boolean empty)
        If universal is true min will be set to negative infinity and max will be set to positive infinity. If empty is true the interval will represent the empty set
        Parameters:
        universal - - if true the interval will represent all the real numbers
        empty - - if true the interval will represent the empty set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if min is greater or equal to max

    • Method Detail

      • getMin

        public double getMin()
              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Return the min value of the interval, if the set is empty the return a null value
        Returns:
        min
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if you try to get the min value when the interval in an empty Interval

      • getMax

        public double getMax()
              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Return the max value of the interval, if the set is empty the return a null value
        Returns:
        max
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if you try to get the max value when the interval in an empty Interval

      • isUniversal

        public boolean isUniversal()
        Returns true if the interval represent the Universal interval [ -inf , inf ]
        Returns:
        true if it is the universal interval, false otherwise

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if empty set
        Returns:
        true if empty set, false otherwise

      • intersects

        public Interval intersects(Interval interval1)
        Verifies if two Intervals intersect and if they do returns a new Interval with the intersection of them. If they don't intersects then return and empty interval
        Parameters:
        interval1 - interval to compare
        Returns:
        Returns null if not intersect, otherwise returns a new tuple with the intersection of the two
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the interval passed is null.

      • complement

        public IntervalSet complement()
        This will find the complement of an interval. The complement is the outer boundaries of the interval and will represented by a pair of intervals that group all values that do not fall in the range of the passed interval.
        Returns:
        an IntervalSet containing the intervals that represent the complement of inputed interval
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the interval passed is null.

      • union

        public static IntervalSet union(Interval interval1,
                                Interval interval2)
        Takes 2 intervals and if they intersect, will return an interval set with one interval representing both intervals. If they don't intersect, it will return an interval set containing both intervals.
        Parameters:
        interval1 - interval one of to be joined.
        interval2 - interval two to be joined.
        Returns:
        interval set containing an interval or intervals to represent the union operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the intervals is null or if both intervals are equal.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double element)
        This method will return true if the element is within the range of the target interval.
        Parameters:
        element - double number to find in range.
        Returns:
        true if in range false otherwise.
